page.title: 13Bradninch Papermill
page.content: {Bradninch}Papermill is situated in {Hele.}It is about 2km from our school} map (grid ref.996025). Paper was first made there in 1767. It was built by the River{Culm}because the water was needed to produce the paper. It was also built by the{railway.}This transported raw materials and finished products. Nowadays the River Culm is still needed for water. The factory also gets water from the wells close to the mill. After using the water it is treated to remove pollution at a treament works on the hill behind Strathculm Road. The water is used several times before it leaves. Paper is taken from the mill by large lorries. Wiggins Teape send their paper to Europe, India, South Africa, New Zealand and parts of the Middle East.
